an6.58:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ye āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā te saṁvarena pahīnā honti,
an6.58:2.2.en: It’s a mendicant who, by restraint, has given up the defilements that should be given up by restraint.

an6.58:2.3.pli: ye āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā te paṭisevanāya pahīnā honti,
an6.58:2.3.en: By using, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by using.

an6.58:2.4.pli: ye āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā te adhivāsanāya pahīnā honti,
an6.58:2.4.en: By enduring, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by enduring.

an6.58:2.5.pli: ye āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā te parivajjanāya pahīnā honti,
an6.58:2.5.en: By avoiding, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by avoiding.

an6.58:2.6.pli: ye āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā te vinodanāya pahīnā honti,
an6.58:2.6.en: By getting rid, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by getting rid.

an6.58:2.7.pli: ye āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā te bhāvanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:2.7.en: By developing, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by developing.

an6.58:3.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā ye saṁvarena pahīnā honti?
an6.58:3.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by restraint?

an6.58:3.10.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā ye saṁvarena pahīnā honti.
an6.58:3.10.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by restraint.

an6.58:4.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā ye paṭisevanāya pahīnā honti?
an6.58:4.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by using?

an6.58:4.11.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā ye paṭisevanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:4.11.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by using.

an6.58:5.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā ye adhivāsanāya pahīnā honti?
an6.58:5.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by enduring?

an6.58:5.4.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā ye adhivāsanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:5.4.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by enduring.

an6.58:6.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā ye parivajjanāya pahīnā honti?
an6.58:6.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by avoiding?

an6.58:6.4.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā ye parivajjanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:6.4.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by avoiding.

an6.58:7.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā ye vinodanāya pahīnā honti?
an6.58:7.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by getting rid?

an6.58:7.7.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā ye vinodanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:7.7.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by getting rid.

an6.58:8.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā ye bhāvanāya pahīnā honti?
an6.58:8.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by developing?

an6.58:8.10.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā ye bhāvanāya pahīnā honti.
an6.58:8.10.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by developing.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 6
6. The Great Chapter
58. Defilements

mn2:4.1.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā, atthi āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā.
mn2:4.1.en: Some defilements should be given up by seeing, some by restraint, some by using, some by enduring, some by avoiding, some by dispelling, and some by developing.

mn2:5.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā?
mn2:5.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by seeing?

mn2:10.11.pli: Tassa amanasikaraṇīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ amanasikārā manasikaraṇīyānaṁ dhammānaṁ manasikārā anuppannā ceva āsavā na uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pahīyanti.
mn2:10.11.en: Because of not paying attention to what they should not and paying attention to what they should, unarisen defilements don’t arise and arisen defilements are given up.

mn2:11.4.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā.
mn2:11.4.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by seeing.

mn2:12.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā?
mn2:12.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by restraint?

mn2:12.11.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā.
mn2:12.11.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by restraint.

mn2:13.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā?
mn2:13.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by using?

mn2:17.2.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā.
mn2:17.2.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by using.

mn2:18.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā?
mn2:18.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by enduring?

mn2:18.4.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā.
mn2:18.4.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by enduring.

mn2:19.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā?
mn2:19.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by avoiding?

mn2:19.5.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā.
mn2:19.5.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by avoiding.

mn2:20.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā?
mn2:20.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by dispelling?

mn2:20.4.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā.
mn2:20.4.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by dispelling.

mn2:21.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā?
mn2:21.1.en: And what are the defilements that should be given up by developing?

mn2:21.10.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā.
mn2:21.10.en: These are called the defilements that should be given up by developing.

mn2:22.1.pli: Yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ye āsavā dassanā pahātabbā te dassanā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā saṁvarā pahātabbā te saṁvarā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā paṭisevanā pahātabbā te paṭisevanā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā te adhivāsanā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā parivajjanā pahātabbā te parivajjanā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā te vinodanā pahīnā honti, ye āsavā bhāvanā pahātabbā te bhāvanā pahīnā honti;
mn2:22.1.en: Now, take a mendicant who, by seeing, has given up the defilements that should be given up by seeing. By restraint, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by restraint. By using, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by using. By enduring, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by enduring. By avoiding, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by avoiding. By dispelling, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by dispelling. By developing, they’ve given up the defilements that should be given up by developing.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 2
All the Defilements

dn34:1.2.1.pli: Eko, āvuso, dhammo bahukāro, eko dhammo bhāvetabbo, eko dhammo pariññeyyo, eko dhammo pahātabbo, eko dhammo hānabhāgiyo, eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo, eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho, eko dhammo uppādetabbo, eko dhammo abhiññeyyo, eko dhammo sacchikātabbo.
dn34:1.2.1.en: Reverends, one thing is helpful, one thing should be developed, one thing should be completely understood, one thing should be given up, one thing makes things worse, one thing leads to distinction, one thing is hard to comprehend, one thing should be produced, one thing should be directly known, one thing should be realized.

dn34:1.2.11.en: What one thing should be given up?

dn34:1.3.1.pli: Dve dhammā bahukārā, dve dhammā bhāvetabbā, dve dhammā pariññeyyā, dve dhammā pahātabbā, dve dhammā hānabhāgiyā, dve dhammā visesabhāgiyā, dve dhammā duppaṭivijjhā, dve dhammā uppādetabbā, dve dhammā abhiññeyyā, dve dhammā sacchikātabbā.
dn34:1.3.1.en: Two things are helpful, two things should be developed, two things should be completely understood, two things should be given up, two things make things worse, two things lead to distinction, two things are hard to comprehend, two things should be produced, two things should be directly known, two things should be realized.

dn34:1.3.11.en: What two things should be given up?

dn34:1.4.13.en: What three things should be given up?

dn34:1.5.17.en: What four things should be given up?

dn34:1.6.19.en: What five things should be given up?

dn34:1.7.21.en: What six things should be given up?

dn34:1.8.27.en: What seven things should be given up?

dn34:2.1.38.en: What eight things should be given up?

dn34:2.2.30.en: What nine things should be given up?

dn34:2.3.1.pli: Dasa dhammā bahukārā …pe… dasa dhammā sacchikātabbā.
dn34:2.3.1.en: Ten things are helpful, ten things should be developed, ten things should be completely understood, ten things should be given up, ten things make things worse, ten things lead to distinction, ten things are hard to comprehend, ten things should be produced, ten things should be directly known, ten things should be realized.

dn34:2.3.52.en: What ten things should be given up?

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 34
Up to Ten

an10.23:1.1.pli: “Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya.
an10.23:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.

an10.23:1.2.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena.
an10.23:1.2.en: There are things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.

an10.23:1.3.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:1.3.en: There are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:2.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya?
an10.23:2.1.en: And what are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech?

an10.23:2.7.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā kāyena pahātabbā, no vācāya.
an10.23:2.7.en: These are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.

an10.23:3.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena?
an10.23:3.1.en: And what are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body?

an10.23:3.7.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā vācāya pahātabbā, no kāyena.
an10.23:3.7.en: These are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.

an10.23:4.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā?
an10.23:4.1.en: And what are the things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom?

an10.23:4.9.pli: macchariyaṁ, bhikkhave, neva kāyena pahātabbaṁ no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbaṁ.
an10.23:4.9.en: and stinginess are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:5.1.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, issā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:5.1.en: Nasty jealousy should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:6.1.pli: Pāpikā, bhikkhave, icchā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:6.1.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

an10.23:6.13.pli: Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā neva kāyena pahātabbā no vācāya, paññāya disvā pahātabbā.
an10.23:6.13.en: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10
3. The Great Chapter
23. Body

mn54:4.4.en: Killing living creatures should be given up, relying on not killing living creatures.

mn54:4.5.en: Stealing should be given up, relying on not stealing.

mn54:4.6.en: Lying should be given up, relying on speaking the truth.

mn54:4.7.pli: apisuṇaṁ vācaṁ nissāya pisuṇā vācā pahātabbā;
mn54:4.7.en: Divisive speech should be given up, relying on speech that isn’t divisive.

mn54:4.8.en: Greed and lust should be given up, relying on not being greedy and lustful.

mn54:4.9.en: Blaming and insulting should be given up, relying on not blaming and not insulting.

mn54:4.10.en: Anger and distress should be given up, relying on not being angry and distressed.

mn54:4.11.en: Arrogance should be given up, relying on not being arrogant.

mn54:6.1.pli: “‘Apāṇātipātaṁ nissāya pāṇātipāto pahātabbo’ti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
mn54:6.1.en: “‘Killing living creatures should be given up, relying on not killing living creatures.’ That’s what I said, but why did I say it?

mn54:6.7.en: ‘Killing living creatures should be given up, relying on not killing living creatures.’

mn54:13.1.pli: ‘Anatimānaṁ nissāya atimāno pahātabbo’ti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
mn54:13.1.en: Arrogance should be given up, relying on not being arrogant.’ That’s what I said, but why did I say it?

mn54:13.7.en: ‘Arrogance should be given up by not being arrogant.’

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 54
With Potaliya the Wanderer

an7.47:8.1.pli: Tayome, brāhmaṇa, aggī pahātabbā parivajjetabbā, na sevitabbā.
an7.47:8.1.en: Brahmin, these three fires should be given up and rejected, not cultivated.

an7.47:9.1.pli: Kasmā cāyaṁ, brāhmaṇa, rāgaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo?
an7.47:9.1.en: And why should the fire of greed be given up and rejected, not cultivated?

an7.47:9.4.pli: Tasmāyaṁ rāgaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo.
an7.47:9.4.en: That’s why the fire of greed should be given up and rejected, not cultivated.

an7.47:10.1.pli: Kasmā cāyaṁ, brāhmaṇa, dosaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo?
an7.47:10.1.en: And why should the fire of hate be given up and rejected, not cultivated?

an7.47:10.4.pli: Tasmāyaṁ dosaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo.
an7.47:10.4.en: That’s why the fire of hate should be given up and rejected, not cultivated.

an7.47:11.1.pli: Kasmā cāyaṁ, brāhmaṇa, mohaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo?
an7.47:11.1.en: And why should the fire of delusion be given up and rejected, not cultivated?

an7.47:11.4.pli: Tasmāyaṁ mohaggi pahātabbo parivajjetabbo, na sevitabbo.
an7.47:11.4.en: That’s why the fire of delusion should be given up and rejected, not cultivated.

an7.47:11.5.pli: Ime kho tayo, brāhmaṇa, aggī pahātabbā parivajjetabbā, na sevitabbā.
an7.47:11.5.en: These three fires should be given up and rejected, not cultivated.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7
5. A Great Sacrifice
47. Fires (2nd)

an4.254:1.4.en: There are things that should be given up by direct knowledge.

an4.254:3.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā?
an4.254:3.1.en: And what are the things that should be given up by direct knowledge?

an4.254:3.3.pli: ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā.
an4.254:3.3.en: These are called the things that should be given up by direct knowledge.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4
26. Insight
254. Insight

sn45.159:1.3.pli: ye dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā, te dhamme abhiññā pajahati, ye dhammā abhiññā sacchikātabbā, te dhamme abhiññā sacchikaroti, ye dhammā abhiññā bhāvetabbā, te dhamme abhiññā bhāveti.
sn45.159:1.3.en: They give up by direct knowledge the things that should be given up by direct knowledge. They realize by direct knowledge the things that should be realized by direct knowledge. They develop by direct knowledge the things that should be developed by direct knowledge.

sn45.159:2.6.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā?
sn45.159:2.6.en: And what are the things that should be given up by direct knowledge?

sn45.159:2.8.en: These are the things that should be given up by direct knowledge.

Linked Discourses 45
12. Hard Work
159. A Guest House

mn149:10.12.pli: Ye dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā te dhamme abhiññā pajahati.
mn149:10.12.en: They give up by direct knowledge those things that should be given up by direct knowledge.

mn149:11.5.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā abhiññā pahātabbā?
mn149:11.5.en: And what are the things that should be given up by direct knowledge?

mn149:11.7.en: These are the things that should be given up by direct knowledge.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 149
The Great Discourse on the Six Sense Fields

mn44:27.1.pli: “Sukhāya panāyye, vedanāya kiṁ pahātabbaṁ, dukkhāya vedanāya kiṁ pahātabbaṁ, adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya kiṁ pahātabban”ti?
mn44:27.1.en: “What should be given up in regard to each of these three feelings?”

mn44:27.2.pli: “Sukhāya kho, āvuso visākha, vedanāya rāgānusayo pahātabbo, dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayo pahātabbo, adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayo pahātabbo”ti.
mn44:27.2.en: “The underlying tendency to greed should be given up when it comes to pleasant feeling. The underlying tendency to repulsion should be given up when it comes to painful feeling. The underlying tendency to ignorance should be given up when it comes to neutral feeling.”

mn44:28.1.pli: “Sabbāya nu kho, ayye, sukhāya vedanāya rāgānusayo pahātabbo, sabbāya dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayo pahātabbo, sabbāya adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayo pahātabbo”ti?
mn44:28.1.en: “Should these underlying tendencies be given up regarding all instances of these feelings?”

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 44
The Shorter Classification

sn35.24:1.4.pli: Cakkhuṁ, bhikkhave, pahātabbaṁ, rūpā pahātabbā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ pahātabbaṁ, cakkhusamphasso pahātabbo, yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi pahātabbaṁ …pe…
sn35.24:1.4.en: The eye should be given up. Sights should be given up. Eye consciousness should be given up. Eye contact should be given up. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact should also be given up.

sn35.24:1.8.pli: mano pahātabbo, dhammā pahātabbā, manoviññāṇaṁ pahātabbaṁ, manosamphasso pahātabbo, yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi pahātabbaṁ.
sn35.24:1.8.en: mind should be given up. Thoughts should be given up. Mind consciousness should be given up. Mind contact should be given up. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact should be given up.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 35
3. All
24. Giving Up

sn35.25:1.4.pli: Cakkhuṁ, bhikkhave, abhiññā pariññā pahātabbaṁ, rūpā abhiññā pariññā pahātabbā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ abhiññā pariññā pahātabbaṁ, cakkhusamphasso abhiññā pariññā pahātabbo, yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi abhiññā pariññā pahātabbaṁ …pe…
sn35.25:1.4.en: The eye should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Sights should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Eye consciousness should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Eye contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding.

sn35.25:1.8.pli: mano abhiññā pariññā pahātabbo, dhammā abhiññā pariññā pahātabbā, manoviññāṇaṁ abhiññā pariññā pahātabbaṁ, manosamphasso abhiññā pariññā pahātabbo, yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā tampi abhiññā pariññā pahātabbaṁ.
sn35.25:1.8.en: mind should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Thoughts should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Mind consciousness should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. Mind contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact should be given up by direct knowledge and complete understanding.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 35
3. All
25. Giving Up By Direct Knowledge and Complete Understanding

an4.188:3.4.pli: Taṁ kho panidaṁ akusalaṁ pahātabbanti kho, upaka, mayā paññattaṁ.
an4.188:3.4.en: I’ve declared: ‘The unskillful should be given up.’

an4.188:3.6.en: ‘This is another way of saying that the unskillful should be given up.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4
19. Brahmins
188. With Upaka

an10.94:7.9.pli: nāhaṁ, gahapati, sabbo paṭinissaggo paṭinissajjitabboti vadāmi.
an10.94:7.9.en: I don’t say that everything should be given up.

an10.94:7.10.pli: Na panāhaṁ, gahapati, sabbo paṭinissaggo na paṭinissajjitabboti vadāmi;
an10.94:7.10.en: But I don’t say that nothing should be given up.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 10
10. With Upāli
94. With Vajjiyamāhita

sn56.29:2.2.pli: Dukkhaṁ, bhikkhave, ariyasaccaṁ pariññeyyaṁ, dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccaṁ pahātabbaṁ, dukkhanirodhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ sacchikātabbaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā ariyasaccaṁ bhāvetabbaṁ.
sn56.29:2.2.en: The noble truth of suffering should be completely understood. The noble truth of the origin of suffering should be given up. The noble truth of the cessation of suffering should be realized. The noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering should be developed.

mlDocs.title:

3. At the Village of Koṭi
29. Should Be Completely Understood

sn56.12:2.2.pli: ‘Taṁ kho panidaṁ dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccaṁ pahātabban’ti, bhikkhave, tathāgatānaṁ pubbe …pe… udapādi.
sn56.12:2.2.en: ‘This noble truth of the origin of suffering should be given up.’ …

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 56
2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma
12. The Realized Ones

sn36.3:1.4.pli: Sukhāya, bhikkhave, vedanāya rāgānusayo pahātabbo, dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayo pahātabbo, adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya avijjānusayo pahātabbo.
sn36.3:1.4.en: The underlying tendency to greed should be given up when it comes to pleasant feeling. The underlying tendency to repulsion should be given up when it comes to painful feeling. The underlying tendency to ignorance should be given up when it comes to neutral feeling.

sn56.11:6.2.en: ‘This noble truth of the origin of suffering should be given up.’ Such was the vision that arose in me …
